description:
Tattah's youngest brother, Tuftuf, is new to programming.

Since his older brother is such a good programmer, his biggest dream is to outshine him. Tuftuf is a student at the German University in Cairo (GUC) where he learns to write programs in Gava.

Today, Tuftuf was introduced to Gava's unsigned integer datatypes. Gava has $ n $ unsigned integer datatypes of sizes (in bits) $ a_{1},a_{2},...\ a_{n} $ . The $ i $ -th datatype have size $ a_{i} $ bits, so it can represent every integer between $ 0 $ and $ 2^{a_{i}}-1 $ inclusive.

Tuftuf is thinking of learning a better programming language. If there exists an integer $ x $ , such that $ x $ fits in some type $ i $ (in $ a_{i} $ bits) and $ x·x $ does not fit in some other type $ j $ (in $ a_{j} $ bits) where $ a_{i}<a_{j} $ , then Tuftuf will stop using Gava.

Your task is to determine Tuftuf's destiny.
inputFormat: The first line contains integer $ n $ ( $ 2<=n<=10^{5} $ ) — the number of Gava's unsigned integer datatypes' sizes. The second line contains a single-space-separated list of $ n $ integers ( $ 1<=a_{i}<=10^{9} $ ) — sizes of datatypes in bits. Some datatypes may have equal sizes.
outputFormat: Print "YES" if Tuftuf will stop using Gava, and "NO" otherwise.
hint: In the second example, $ x=7 $ $ (111_{2}) $ fits in $ 3 $ bits, but $ x^{2}=49 $ $ (110001_{2}) $ does not fit in $ 4 $ bits.
translation:
题意如下：
给定$n$个数$a_1,a_2,...,a_n$

问是否存在自然数$x$使得满足以下条件：

>$$x < 2^{a_i}$$
>$$x^2 > 2^{a_j}-1$$
>$$a_i < a_j$$
若存在则输出"YES"(没有双引号)不然输出"NO"

其中$ 2≤n≤10^5 $ $1≤a_i≤10^9$
